person.persName: Thomas W. Scott (Franklin County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of John R. Scott and Sidney J. Scott. Attended school in Franklin County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eighteen enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Attended school in Franklin County in 1860. Household owned twenty-six enslaved people in Franklin County in 1860. Farmer in Franklin County in 1862. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from March 15, 1863 to May 10, 1865. Surrendered at Wilkes County, Georgia, on May 10, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U.S. government on May 20, 1865.
